page.title: 04PUBLIC FOOTPATHS
page.content: There is a network of public footpaths criss-crossing the area. Before the advent of the Motor-car, these footpaths were well used and necessary for the inhabitants, many of them now having fallen into disuse. At present the main footpath which passes through the block is the long distance "Offa's Dyke Footpath" which stretches from Prestatyn on the North Wales Coast to Chepstow on the Bristol Channel. This was planned by the Countryside Commission and officially opened in 1972. It mostly follows the line of old established paths but in some places it follows little used minor roads. It is popular with walkers all year round.
